stem: What is the difference between the Google Cloud Console and Cloud Shell?
options/0/title: There is no difference as these tools are 100% identical.
options/0/rationale: They are not 100% identical. Please go back and review the lectures in this module.
options/1/title: Cloud Shell is a locally installed tool, while the Cloud Console is a temporary virtual machine.
options/1/rationale: I recommend reviewing the lectures in this module.
options/2/title: Cloud Shell is a command-line tool, while the Cloud Console is a graphical user interface
options/2/rationale: The Cloud Console is a graphical user interface and Cloud Shell is a command-line tool. Both tools allow you to interact with Google Cloud. Even though the Cloud Console can do things Cloud Shell can't do and vice-versa, don’t think of them as alternatives, but think of them as one extremely flexible and powerful interface.
options/3/title: The Cloud Console is a command-line tool, while Cloud Shell is a graphical user interface
options/3/rationale: That's incorrect. I recommend reviewing the lectures in this module.

stem: Which of the following does not allow you to interact with Google Cloud?
options/0/rationale: That's correct! There are four ways you can interact with Google Cloud: There’s the Cloud Console, Cloud Shell and the Cloud SDK, the APIs, and the Cloud Mobile App. The Cloud Explorer is not a Google Cloud tool.
options/1/rationale: That's incorrect. I recommend going back to the lectures of this module to review this concept.
options/2/rationale: That's incorrect. I recommend reviewing the lectures in this module.
options/3/rationale: That's incorrect. Please go back and review the lectures in this module.
